title: My.Favorite.Brunette.1947.720p.HDDVD.x264-Codres
description:
[b]My personal rip from the HDDVD. You have spanish subs.
This is a must see comedy!!!! The scene where Peter Lorre try to "place" a ring for Hope to "find" is memorable. I'll guarantee that you'll laugh so hard that you'll fall from the chair :)[/b]

[img]http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51%2B3fX-CIqL._SS500_.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img385.imageshack.us/img385/5941/16wr.jpg[/img]

[QUOTE]Baby photographer Ronnie Jackson (Bob Hope) is mistaken for a private eye; when an attractive brunette (Dorothy Lamour) hires him to find a missing person, he doesnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t mind going along with the fantasy. The director is reunited with Hope for, not a sequel to My Favorite Blonde (1942), but a spoof of all the film-noir thrillers of the period, with the star as a less-than-brave gumshoe who has a wisecrack for every dangerous situation heÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s in. Hope is funny and the movie well-paced, even though the story is for the birds. Straight-faced supporting performances by the likes of Peter Lorre help.[/QUOTE]

1947-U.S. 85 min. B/W. Directed by Elliott Nugent. Cast: Bob Hope (Ronnie Jackson), Dorothy Lamour (Carlotta Montay), Peter Lorre (Kismet), Lon Chaney, Jr., John Hoyt, Reginald Denny. Cameos: Alan Ladd, Bing Crosby. 

Quote: ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œNutty as a fruitcake, and with all that beautiful frosting.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (Hope on Lamour)
